frame.name: Text
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Text</fen> is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a <fen>Topic</fen>, created by an <fen>Author</fen> at the <fen>Time_of_creation</fen>. It may be a physical entity that is made of a certain <fen>Material</fen> etc. It may be constructed for an <fen>Honoree</fen>.
<ex>It was a good <t>book</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Author
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Author</fen> is the person who produced a particular <fen>Text</fen>.
<ex>I'm glad I bought and read <fex name="Author">Robbins's</fex> <t>book</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated FE for each LU in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>The person for whom the <fen>Text</fen> is produced. <ex>The <fex name="Text"><t>poem</t></fex> <fex name="Beneficiary">for Caitlin</fex> was included in an anthology .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Text</fen> was created.
<ex>Jackson's new story is based on a <fex name="Time_of_creation">1980</fex> <t>novel</t> by his father.</ex> <ex><t>Poems</t> <fex name="Time_of_creation">from the end of that dynasty</fex> are known to contain many novel metric structures.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>What a <fen>Text</fen> is made of (if applicable). <ex>The library was so old, it was filled with <fex name="Mat">vellum</fex> <fex name="Text"><t>tomes</t></fex>, not a paperback in sight.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Containing_text
FE.definition: <def-root>This is a text in which the <fen>Text</fen> is located. <ex>The last <fex name="Text"><t>poem</t></fex> <fex name="Cont_text">in the anthology</fex> was horrid.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Genre
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Genre</fen> or sub-<fen>Genre</fen> of the <fen>Text</fen>.
<ex>She writes only <fex name="Genre">historical</fex> <fex name="Text"><t>fiction</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>I've got three <fex name="Genre">comedic</fex> <fex name="Text"><t>screenplays</t></fex> on my desk right now!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The use for which the text was produced; its purpose.
<ex>She read through the bicycle's <fex name="Use">construction</fex> <fex name="Text"><t>manual</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subpart
FE.definition: <def-root>The smaller texts that make up the <fen>Text</fen>. <ex>He found it in a <fex name="Text"><t>book</t></fex> <fex name="Cmpnt">of spells</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is what the <fen>Text</fen> is about.<ex>I read a <fex name="Text"><t>book</t></fex> <fex name="Topic">about knitting</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Title
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Title</fen> of a <fen>Text</fen>.
<ex>She read <fex name="Title">Sassy</fex> <fex name="Text"><t>magazine</t></fex>.</ex> <ex>Current NOW President Kim Gandy said Friedan's <fex name="Title">Feminine Mystique</fex> <t>book</t> opened women's eyes.</ex>
NOTE: when the <fen>Title</fen> is expressed in an appositive clause, it is labeled as <fen>Text</fen> on the first layer and <fen>Title</fen> on the second.
<ex>She read the <t>magazine</t> <fex name="Text">Sassy</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the language in which a text is composed, or the physical medium (radio, ink) in which it is distributed.
<ex>Science <fex name="Text"><t>articles</t></fex> <fex name="Medium">in Greek</fex> are difficult to understand for me.</ex>
<ex>It's prudent to pay attention to <fex name="Medium">radio</fex> <t>bulletins</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: autobiografie.n
lexUnit.definition: over het leven van de auteur zelf

lexUnit.name: kroniek.n
lexUnit.definition: waarin feiten en voorvallen worden opgesomd in de volgorde waarin ze gebeurd zijn

lexUnit.name: elegie.n
lexUnit.definition: over het verlies van het aangename dat men vroeger bezat

lexUnit.name: novelle.n
lexUnit.definition: in proza dat korter is dan een roman en langer dan een kort verhaal

lexUnit.name: ode.n
lexUnit.definition: waarmee je iemand of iets prijst of eert

lexUnit.name: gedicht.n
lexUnit.definition: die zorgvuldig is geconstrueerd, waarin de keuze en de schikking van de woorden, het ritme, evt. rijm e.d. bijdragen tot de expressieve waarde

lexUnit.name: sonnet.n
lexUnit.definition: van veertien regels, dat min of meer uit twee delen bestaat: twee strofen van vier regels en twee strofen van drie regels

lexUnit.name: trilogie.n
lexUnit.definition: van drie bij elkaar horende literaire producten als romans, toneelstukken maar ook als films, met meestal hetzelfde hoofdpersonage

lexUnit.name: necrologie.n
lexUnit.definition: van iemand die pas overleden is, bijv. in een krant

lexUnit.name: scriptie.n
lexUnit.definition: dat je voor je studie moet schrijven

lexUnit.name: pamflet.n
lexUnit.definition: over een actueel onderwerp ter informatie van het publiek, vaak fel van toon en tegen iets of iemand gericht
